text: KL Sports City (formerly Bukit Jalil National Sports Complex) is the largest sports complex in Malaysia. It is located in , 20 km south of Kuala Lumpur. Known as the "sports complex in a park", it was unique in the country and region when fully developed. It was officially opened by Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on 11 July 1998 for the 1998 Commonwealth Games. The complex was upgraded in 2017 for the Southeast Asian Games. ==References == Category:Buildings and structures in Malaysia Category:Stadiums in Asia
title: KL Sports City
